page.title: 13A SOUTH HYLTON FOOTPATH
page.content: There used to be a railway line from Sunderland to Durham. This line passed through S.Hylton. For a long time after the line was closed it was just waste land. Now the council have turned it into a good footpath using small rocks with grass on either side. In some places they have planted trees and shrubs but many have been vandalised. The path is very popular and people use it for walking, cycling, dog exercising, jogging and horse riding. Sadly motor cyclists sometimes use the path and are a nuisance. Some time ago a woman was killed on the path by a motor cyclist. The council have erected barriers to try to stop the motor cyclists. The barriers have gaps for prams and are low enough for cycles to be lifted over.
